item.title: Enormous puddle, 29th January
item.description:
The puddle here is so dangerous, any tiny amount of rain fills both sides of the road. Water constantly pours out of the drains. Pedestrians can't walk down the road, one side Is flooded and there isn't a path the other side. I live right by this flood and it's super dangerous, I've witnessed many near misses and bumps from people driving in the middle of the road. It's been months now, it's not acceptable
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Systemic blocked drain issue, 29th January
item.description:
I've reported this particular drain before and work was carried out, however, it has made no difference at all. Straight after the work was completed the drain still looked sunken into the kerb and flooding was not sorted. I've walked from the top of Prestbury High St. to part way down Prestbury Rd. and many of the drains are partially or fully blocked. This is a long-term issue (years) where the whole drainage system in this area needs looking at. Even if one is unblocked, the next one down the road might still stop the flow of water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Prescott Walk, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I would like to bring to your attention a safety concern related to the Southam Lane bus stop, which is frequently used by GE Aerospace employees. I inadvertently reported this issue under the incorrect section labeled "Traffic Lights," and I apologize for any confusion this may have caused. As a regular user of bus D from the Southam Lane stop, I have observed that crossing the road at this point poses significant risks. There is currently no pedestrian traffic light at this intersection, requiring pedestrians to watch for vehicles coming from three different directions. Furthermore, there are two traffic lights for cars in opposing lanes, which adds to the confusion from a pedestrian standpoint. I have witnessed instances where vehicles have disregarded the red light, creating a hazardous situation for those crossing the road. The potential for a serious accident is a genuine concern, especially since this crossing is heavily utilized by fellow employees. I strongly recommend the installation of a dedicated pedestrian traffic light and overall improvements to the crossing to enhance pedestrian safety. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Sincerely, Elif, 29th January
item.description:
Intersection between Southam Lane, Hyde Lane and A435. The traffic lights
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Drainage still blocked, 29th January
item.description:
Heading north from Prestbury, after crossing the brook, all the drain covers are badly blocked all the way up the the layby just passed the Ellenborough Park hotel entrance. The gutter and road side is full of dirt and badly needs sweeping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury

item.title: Drop kerb to small for entry to address, 29th January
item.description:
Hello there is already a job in progress. TMC - Defects - Other problem Reported in the TMC - Defects - Other category by Gloucestershire County Council at 14:32 29/01/25 Reference: JOB_42567231 This is a recurring problem caused by the drop kerb being too small for the drive entry. Any filling and reseeding of verge will just be eroded by vehicles entering the drive. A hole develops which causes damage to tyres and underside of vehicles. If the drop kerb is widened then no future issues will be caused. This saves money to the council in the long run. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Beeches Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: A channel has been dug across the road and poorly filled in, 29th January
item.description:
Road works have dug a channel across the road that runs down the side of GE, and they have not filled it in properly creating a large hole that is especially bad travelling north on the road from the roundabout. Issue has been there for a few days, and is at high risk of damaging car wheels/tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
